contentrichtext.text: '''Zadock Thompson''' (1796-1856), a famous [[Vermont]] [[Natural history|naturalist]], professor, and [[Episcopal Church in the United States of America|Episcopal]] [[priest]], was born in [[Bridgewater, Vermont|Bridgewater]], [[Windsor County, Vermont|Windsor County]], [[Vermont]] on 23 May 1796 and died in [[Burlington, Vermont|Burlington]], [[Chittenden County, Vermont|Chittenden County]], [[Vermont]] on 19 January 1856. During his lifetime, Thompson published numerous books on Vermont's history, the most notable being the ''History of the State of Vermont'' (1833) and ''History of the State of Vermont, Natural, Civil and Statistical'' (1842). Thompson married Phebe Boyce and had three children: George Boyce Thompson, Harriet Towner Thompson, and Adeline Perry Thompson. Only his daughter, Adeline, survived [[childhood]] to bear four children before her early death at 30 years of age. ==External links== * [http://www.uvm.edu/~biology/Museum/ZTM.html Zadock Thompson Natural History Museum] * [http://cdi.uvm.edu/findingaids/collection/thompson.ead.xml Inventory of the Zadock Thompson Papers, Special Collections, University of Vermont Library] {{Authority control|VIAF=390971}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Thompson, Zadock | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American naturalist | DATE OF BIRTH = 1796 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1857 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Thompson, Zadock}} [[Category:1796 births]] [[Category:1857 deaths]] [[Category:American naturalists]] [[Category:American historians]] [[Category:Historians of the United States]] [[Category:Anglican priests]] [[Category:People from Windsor County, Vermont]] {{Vermont-stub}}
